SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Load Data on the Shopping Cart Page Version 1.0 More Efficiently

If you choose to continue using Shopping Cart page version 1.0, your storefront users can enjoy improved performance when loading cart data.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: If your implementation uses the ccrz.cc_api_PriceAdjustment or ccrz.cc_Api_CartExtension extension points, this change slightly modifies the format of subscription product data available to those extension points. After you install the new version of the managed package, evaluate your return data and update your implementation to accommodate the changes, if necessary.

To help you migrate your extensions, B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides a new configuration setting on the Cart module, Previous Cart Fetch Logic. The configuration setting is available after you update the available global data in CC Admin | Global Settings | Data Loader. By default, this setting is FALSE. We recommend that you always use FALSE in a production environment. To restore the cart fetch behavior from previous versions of B2B Commerce for Visualforce and troubleshoot a data issue, change this setting to TRUE.

NOTE The Previous Cart Fetch Logic configuration setting is compatible only with the Shopping Cart page version 1.0.

title: Optimizing Shopping Cart Performance
